tasks.task: Conducting training workshops on vegetable grafting for local farmers.
subtasks: Deliver theoretical sessions explaining past research on grafting vegetables.
Present practical examples of grafting tomatoes and sweet peppers on various rootstocks.
Discuss the benefits of vegetable grafting, such as reduced disease loss and pesticide use.
Address the role of Integrated Pest Management (IPM) in encouraging the use of grafting as a first-line defense.
Share farmers' positive responses and adoption of grafting techniques.

tasks.task: Preparing and facilitating practical grafting sessions.
subtasks: Coordinate morning sessions starting at 9 AM.
Organize lectures on local grafting research and its applications.
Demonstrate grafting techniques on tomatoes and peppers.
Address farmer questions and provide hands-on guidance.

tasks.task: Promote climate smart agriculture strategies through vegetable grafting.
subtasks: Educate farmers on the importance of reliable produce supply to markets.
Highlight the link between grafting and food security improvement.
Encourage farmers to incorporate grafting in their practices for sustainable production.

tasks.task: Perform vegetable grafting as part of agricultural training.
Attend and participate in a vegetable grafting training workshop.
subtasks: Follow instructions for grafting various vegetables.
Practice grafting techniques on tomatoes and sweet peppers.
Evaluate the success of the grafts under controlled conditions.

tasks.task: Perform vegetable grafting as part of agricultural training.
subtasks: Prepare selected rootstocks for grafting.
Cut scions from desired vegetables.
Apply grafting techniques to join scions and rootstocks.
Water and care for grafted plants post-grafting.
Give theoretical lectures on local grafting research.
Demonstrate grafting techniques on tomatoes and other vegetables.
Supervise participants practicing grafting methods.
Evaluate the success of participants' grafting attempts.
Discuss the benefits of grafting in climate smart agriculture.
Present results from local research on grafting vegetables.
Encourage farmer adoption of grafting practices.

tasks.task: Perform grafting as part of agricultural training.
subtasks: Slice scions from tomato plants.
Prepare rootstocks for grafting.
SUBTASK Apply different grafting techniques.
Water and monitor the newly grafted plants.
